trans-unit.source: Managing Role-Based Access Control with the REST API
trans-unit.target: Managing Role-Based Access Control with the REST API

trans-unit.source: Managing role-based access control with the REST API
trans-unit.target: Managing role-based access control with the REST API

trans-unit.source: Managing Role-Based Access Control with the REST API
trans-unit.target: Managing Role-Based Access Control with the REST API

trans-unit.source: Lists all of the role assignments at the specified scope and sub-scopes.
trans-unit.target: Lists all of the role assignments at the specified scope and sub-scopes.

trans-unit.source: To list role assignments, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/read` operation at the scope.
trans-unit.target: To list role assignments, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/read` operation at the scope.

trans-unit.source: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the role assignments.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the role assignments.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{filter}* with the condition that you wish to apply to filter the role assignment list.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{filter}* with the condition that you wish to apply to filter the role assignment list.

trans-unit.source: To list role assignments for only the specified scope, not including the role assignments at sub-scopes.
trans-unit.target: To list role assignments for only the specified scope, not including the role assignments at sub-scopes.

trans-unit.source: To list role assignments for only specific user, group, or application
trans-unit.target: To list role assignments for only specific user, group, or application

trans-unit.source: Replace *{objectId}* with the Azure AD objectId of the user, group, or service principal.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{objectId}* with the Azure AD objectId of the user, group, or service principal.

trans-unit.source: To list role assignments for only specific user including ones assigned to groups of which the user is a member
trans-unit.target: To list role assignments for only specific user including ones assigned to groups of which the user is a member

trans-unit.source: Replace *{objectId}* with the Azure AD objectId of the user.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{objectId}* with the Azure AD objectId of the user.

trans-unit.source: Get information about a role assignment
trans-unit.target: Get information about a role assignment

trans-unit.source: Gets information about a single role assignment specified by the role assignment identifier.
trans-unit.target: Gets information about a single role assignment specified by the role assignment identifier.

trans-unit.source: To get information about a role assignment, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/read` operation.
trans-unit.target: To get information about a role assignment, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/read` operation.

trans-unit.source: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the role assignments.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the role assignments.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{role-assignment-id}* with the GUID identifier of the role assignment.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{role-assignment-id}* with the GUID identifier of the role assignment.

trans-unit.source: Create a role assignment at the specified scope for the specified principal granting the specified role.
trans-unit.target: Create a role assignment at the specified scope for the specified principal granting the specified role.

trans-unit.source: To create a role assignment, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/write` operation.
trans-unit.target: To create a role assignment, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/write` operation.

trans-unit.source: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **PUT** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **PUT** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the scope at which you wish to create the role assignments.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the scope at which you wish to create the role assignments.

trans-unit.source: When you create a role assignment at a parent scope, all child scopes inherit the same role assignment.
trans-unit.target: When you create a role assignment at a parent scope, all child scopes inherit the same role assignment.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: This will be used as the GUID identifier of the new role assignment.
trans-unit.target: This will be used as the GUID identifier of the new role assignment.

trans-unit.source: For the request body, provide the values in the following format:
trans-unit.target: For the request body, provide the values in the following format:

trans-unit.source: The identifier of the role that is to be assigned.
trans-unit.target: The identifier of the role that is to be assigned.

trans-unit.source: The format of the identifier is: `{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/{role-definition-id-guid}`
trans-unit.target: The format of the identifier is: `{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/{role-definition-id-guid}`

trans-unit.source: objectId of the Azure AD principal (user, group, or service principal) to which the role is to be assigned.
trans-unit.target: objectId of the Azure AD principal (user, group, or service principal) to which the role is to be assigned.

trans-unit.source: Delete a role assignment at the specified scope.
trans-unit.target: Delete a role assignment at the specified scope.

trans-unit.source: To delete a role assignment, you must have access to the `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/delete` operation.
trans-unit.target: To delete a role assignment, you must have access to the `Microsoft.Authorization/roleAssignments/delete` operation.

trans-unit.source: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **DELETE** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **DELETE** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the scope at which you wish to create the role assignments.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the scope at which you wish to create the role assignments.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{role-assignment-id}* with the role assignment id GUID.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{role-assignment-id}* with the role assignment id GUID.

trans-unit.source: Lists all of the role that are available for assignment at the specified scope.
trans-unit.target: Lists all of the role that are available for assignment at the specified scope.

trans-unit.source: To list roles, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/read` operation at the scope.
trans-unit.target: To list roles, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/read` operation at the scope.

trans-unit.source: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the roles.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the roles.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{filter}* with the condition that you wish to apply to filter the list of roles.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{filter}* with the condition that you wish to apply to filter the list of roles.

trans-unit.source: To list roles available for assignment at the specified scope and any of its child scopes.
trans-unit.target: To list roles available for assignment at the specified scope and any of its child scopes.

trans-unit.source: To search for a role using exact display name.
trans-unit.target: To search for a role using exact display name.

trans-unit.source: Replace *{role-display-name}* by the URL encoded form of the exact display name of the role.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{role-display-name}* by the URL encoded form of the exact display name of the role.

trans-unit.source: Gets information about a single role specified by the role definition identifier.
trans-unit.target: Gets information about a single role specified by the role definition identifier.

trans-unit.source: To get information about a single role using its display name, see List all roles and roleName filter.
trans-unit.target: To get information about a single role using its display name, see List all roles and roleName filter.

trans-unit.source: To get information about a role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/read` operation.
trans-unit.target: To get information about a role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/read` operation.

trans-unit.source: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: All of the built-in roles are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **GET** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the role assignments.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the scope for which you wish to list the role assignments.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{role-definition-id}* with the GUID identifier of the role definition.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{role-definition-id}* with the GUID identifier of the role definition.

trans-unit.source: To create a custom role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/write` operation on all of its `AssignableScopes`.
trans-unit.target: To create a custom role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/write` operation on all of its `AssignableScopes`.

trans-unit.source: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **PUT** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **PUT** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the first *AssignableScope* of the custom role.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the first *AssignableScope* of the custom role.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels.
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels.

trans-unit.source: This will be used as the GUID identifier of the new custom role.
trans-unit.target: This will be used as the GUID identifier of the new custom role.

trans-unit.source: For the request body, provide the values in the following format:
trans-unit.target: For the request body, provide the values in the following format:

trans-unit.source: GUID identifier of the custom role.
trans-unit.target: GUID identifier of the custom role.

trans-unit.source: Display name of the custom role.
trans-unit.target: Display name of the custom role.

trans-unit.source: An array of action strings specifying the operations to which the custom role grants access.
trans-unit.target: An array of action strings specifying the operations to which the custom role grants access.

trans-unit.source: An array of action strings specifying the operations that are to be excluded from the operations to which the custom role grants access.
trans-unit.target: An array of action strings specifying the operations that are to be excluded from the operations to which the custom role grants access.

trans-unit.source: An array of scopes in which the custom role can be used for access management.
trans-unit.target: An array of scopes in which the custom role can be used for access management.

trans-unit.source: To modify a custom role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/write` operation on all of its `AssignableScopes`.
trans-unit.target: To modify a custom role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/write` operation on all of its `AssignableScopes`.

trans-unit.source: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the **PUT** method with the following URI:
trans-unit.target: Use the **PUT** method with the following URI:

trans-unit.source: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:
trans-unit.target: Within the URI, make the following substitutions to customize your request:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{scope}* with the first *AssignableScope* of the custom role.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{scope}* with the first *AssignableScope* of the custom role.

trans-unit.source: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:
trans-unit.target: The following examples show how to specify the scope for different levels:

trans-unit.source: Replace *{role-definition-id}* with the GUID identifier of the custom role that is to be updated.
trans-unit.target: Replace *{role-definition-id}* with the GUID identifier of the custom role that is to be updated.

trans-unit.source: For the request body, provide the values in the following format:
trans-unit.target: For the request body, provide the values in the following format:

trans-unit.source: GUID identifier of the custom role to be updated.
trans-unit.target: GUID identifier of the custom role to be updated.

trans-unit.source: Display name of the updated custom role.
trans-unit.target: Display name of the updated custom role.

trans-unit.source: Description of the updated custom role.
trans-unit.target: Description of the updated custom role.

trans-unit.source: An array of action strings specifying the operations to which the updated custom role grants access.
trans-unit.target: An array of action strings specifying the operations to which the updated custom role grants access.

trans-unit.source: An array of action strings specifying the operations that are to be excluded from the operations to which the updated custom role grants access.
trans-unit.target: An array of action strings specifying the operations that are to be excluded from the operations to which the updated custom role grants access.

trans-unit.source: An array of scopes in which the updated custom role can be used for access management.
trans-unit.target: An array of scopes in which the updated custom role can be used for access management.

trans-unit.source: To delete a custom role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/delete` operation on all of its `AssignableScopes`.
trans-unit.target: To delete a custom role, you must have access to `Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/delete` operation on all of its `AssignableScopes`.

trans-unit.source: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.
trans-unit.target: Of the built-in roles, only *Owner* and *User Access Administrator* are granted access to this operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about role assignments and managing access for Azure resources, see [Azure Role-Based Access Control](role-based-access-control-configure.md).
